snippet: The Warhol, “Silver Car Crash (Double Disaster),” is one of only four double-paneled car crash paintings that Warhol created in 1963 and the last of its size left in private hands.
abstract: Powerful and provocative painting by Andy Warhol, Silver Car Crash (Double Disaster), is sold at Sotheby's auction for $104.5 million, making it highest price ever paid at auction for a Warhol work; comes one day after Christie's auction in which Francis Bacon's Three Studies of Lucian Freud brought in $142.4 million.
lead_paragraph: The Warhol, “Silver Car Crash (Double Disaster),” is one of only four double-paneled car crash paintings that Warhol created in 1963 and the last of its size left in private hands.

headline.main: Grisly Warhol Painting Fetches $104.5 Million, Auction High for Artist
headline.print_headline: Grisly Warhol Painting Fetches $104.5 Million, Auction High for Artist
